title: 108_hr3023
content: The Act may be cited as the "Gasoline Availability Stabilization (GAS) Reserves Act" and establishes the Gasoline Availability Stabilization Reserve. The Secretary will establish a Gasoline Availability Stabilization Reserve (GAS Reserve) with a capacity of 20,000,000 barrels of regular unleaded gasoline at designated sites in the Northeast, Midwest, and California. Security measures will be coordinated with the Secretary of Homeland Security. Additionally, a transportation plan will be submitted to Congress, the Secretary of Homeland Security, and State Governors within 2 years of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Homeland Security, State Governors, and Congress will receive a transportation plan for the GAS Reserve. The filling of the reserve must be completed by March 1, 2006. Emergency sales of gasoline from the reserve can be authorized in case of a physical disruption in gasoline supply leading to price volatility in a State. The Secretary of Homeland Security, State Governors, and Congress will receive a transportation plan for the GAS Reserve. Emergency sales from the reserve can be authorized in case of a physical disruption leading to price volatility in a State. The Secretary must respond to a request within 10 days by approving, denying, or requesting additional information. The Secretary must provide the Governor with written notices of approval or denial for the GAS Reserve emergency sale plan. If additional information is requested and not provided within 10 days, the request will be denied. The Secretary is authorized to conduct maintenance transactions for the GAS Reserve system to ensure availability for emergencies. The GAS Reserve is available for emergencies during peak demand periods, with maintenance timed to minimize impact on gasoline prices. The Secretary must report annually on the program's status and recommend any necessary changes. Appropriations are authorized for construction and operation of the GAS Reserve. Appropriations are authorized for construction and operation of the GAS Reserve for fiscal years 2004 through 2009.
